Partially conflicts with #7862: whichever is merged second will need to fix the damage state preview in `WithProductionDoor`.

data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAWeb/pull/178 provides some links to conveniently click. I created test packages at https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/games:openra/development ~~but for some reason I don't understand this won't work.~~

data.title: New OSX launcher
data.body:
- Fixes dialogs hijacking Finder.
- Fixes dock icon being lost when restarting.
- Adds openra:// url handling.
- Adds .orarep file handling.
- Minimum supported OS X version is now 10.6.

data.title: Add proper speech notifications for replays/spectators
data.body:
See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7681#discussion_r26820169.

> [...] spectators [...] are just watching so "Battlecontrol initialized" is misleading anyway.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/10977303-add-proper-speech-notifications-for-replays-spectators?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixes unselectable and untargetable buildings issue.
data.body:
Fixes #7662 but not #3871.

This is done by comparing the bounds (selection boxes) of buildings. If the cursor position intersects bounds of multiple buildings, the one with the smallest bounds area is selected.

data.title: Added a hotkey to take screenshots
data.body:
Closes #5317
Fixes #7624

I added support for a wide range of file formats:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/7104922/d3581e80-e0ff-11e4-83f5-32304ed2a50a.png)

To test press `CTRL` + `P` (this is configurable in the hotkey settings).

data.title: Fixed the AI not avoiding boats when searching for viable paradrop targets
data.body: Tries to lessen https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6636 with the adjusting screws we already got.

data.title: Move ra silo to defense queue
data.body:
4 reasons:
- Consistency with the TD mod
- Lets you build real structures in parallel with the silo, so players that want to build them aren't penalised as much
- The defense queue is actually the support queue, and the silo is a support structure
- People keep asking for it (to me personally, and general discussion on the forum)

data.body: GPS icon appears briefly over frozen actors when they are rendered for the first time.

Fixes #7918.

Works for me (Windows/MS runtime) but if somebody could give a mono runtime a whirl that'd be grand.

data.title: Faster replay browser loading
data.body:
#5971 is back.

The improves the speed of replay loading with several optimizations:
- FieldLoader now caches some of the more expensive reflection calls, which speeds up loading.
- ReplayBrowserLogic will now load replays on another thread so the UI doesn't block.
- ReplayBrowserLogic will load replays in parallel. This means we can use all your cores to load all your replays.
- If you had a lot of replays (we're talking hundreds to thousands), your framerate might drop significantly because it would have to draw so many items in the list, even the ones you couldn't see - I have made a change so it only draws the ones that are visible, which prevents the framerate tanking.

Fixes #5942.

data.title: Delay growing back the shroud when an actor gets killed
data.body: So things like demo truck explosions and sandworm attacks will be visible to the player

data.title: Fix path to freetype library in SharpFont's .dll mapping for OS X
data.body: Fixes #7911

data.title: Add penev92 to AUTHORS
data.body: I figured what better time than when we have two full pages with PRs :)

data.title: Wiki does not auto populate non-trait [Desc] tags
data.body:
After noticing #7659 and #7174 I realized that I had entirely neglected the documentation side of the A.I. support power decision addition.

I've noticed that the [Desc] tags in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/AI/SupportPowerDecision.cs is not being automatically populated into the wiki, presumably because there is no category for non-trait type auto documentation.

I've updated https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Defining-custom-AI in order to explain how the AI decisions work, though it might be useful to make the auto documenting for the wiki also check the rest of the code (or at least sections of it) for [Desc] tags and adding them to some or the other wiki category.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/10836258-wiki-does-not-auto-populate-non-trait-desc-tags?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fails to load - System.TypeInitializationException - Mac OS X 10.10
data.body:
I get the following when trying to run the game. I tried at first running the .app version but that was failing. So I did some digging and found I could command line it using mono from the resources folder. This is the result with the debug flag turned on. There is no X11 folder within /usr on Mac OS X 10.10. 

$ mono --debug OpenRA.Game.exe Game.Mod=ra
Platform is OSX
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 1440x900
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 1440x900
Detected OpenGL version: 2.1
Using OpenAL sound engine
Using default device
Available mods:
    cnc: Tiberian Dawn (playtest-20150408)
    d2k: Dune 2000 (playtest-20150408)
    modchooser: Mod Chooser (playtest-20150408)
    ra: Red Alert (playtest-20150408)
Loading mod: ra
Exception of type `System.TypeInitializationException`: An exception was thrown by the type initializer for OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteFont
Inner Exception of type `System.DllNotFoundException`: /usr/X11/lib/libfreetype.6.dylib
  TypeName=`
    at (wrapper managed-to-native) SharpFont.FT:FT_Init_FreeType (intptr&)
  at SharpFont.Library..ctor () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteFont..cctor () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.<InitializeFonts>m__1 (KeyValuePair`2 x) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[KeyValuePair`2,String,SpriteFont] (IEnumerable`1 source, System.Func`2 keySelector, System.Func`2 elementSelector, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer) [0x0002f] in /private/tmp/source-mono-mac-3.12.99-branch-32/bockbuild-mono-3.12.0-branch/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-3.12.1/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:2928 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[KeyValuePair`2,String,SpriteFont] (IEnumerable`1 source, System.Func`2 keySelector, System.Func`2 elementSelector) [0x00000] in /private/tmp/source-mono-mac-3.12.99-branch-32/bockbuild-mono-3.12.0-branch/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-3.12.1/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:2915 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.InitializeFonts (OpenRA.Manifest m) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod (System.String mod, OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

data.title: Set version before creating docs
data.body: Since the version string gets embedded into the created documentation (see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Lua-API-(playtest), for example).
